description: Cow’s tail pine (Cephalotaxus harringtonia 'Nana') is an amazing evergreen shrub that makes a great addition to any garden. It has highly decorative, glossy dark foliage and upright cones that resemble cow’s tails, hence the name. It is a low maintenance plant, ideal for low-growing hedges, slopes, and rock gardens. This hardy evergreen is cold tolerant and generally pest- and disease-resistant. It is also shade, drought and wind tolerant. This ancient species can live over 100 years and stands out with its unique foliage which has a unique twisted texture and forks at the end of each branch. With its compact size, this amazing shrub adds a burst of vibrant colour to any garden.
